1.SceneDescription:
Central Perk - Chandler, Monica, Phoebe, Ross and Rachel 
  are sitting on the sofas. Joey enters

lines.Line: Monica, hey, can I borrow the Porsche
Ok
Ok
Ok
Alright
Alright
But ehm...what is it not
(abashed) A place to entertain my lady friends
And what else is it not
And what else is it not
(even more abashed) A place to eat spaghetti
Very good! (Gives him the keys) What do you need it for anyway

Oh well, the powerball lottery is upto 300 million and they don't 
  sell tickets here in New York, so..
Oh! So you're driving up to Connecticut
Oh! So you're driving up to Connecticut
Oh! So you're driving up to Connecticut
(hesitates for a moment)Yeah Connecticut...Not West Virginia

Hey, maybe I'll drive you up there! I'd like to buy some tickets

Uh
Uh
Uh
Uh
Uh
Uh
Uh

Yeah with Chandler not getting paid, we could really use 300

Yeah, because if I was at my old job we'd say 300 million?

Hey will you get me tickets too
Hey will you get me tickets too

Yeah me too. oh! I have an idea. Why don't we all pitch in 50 
  bucks, we'll pool our money together and then if we win, we'll split it
yeah thats a great idea
No thanks
No thanks
No thanks
No thanks
No thanks
You don't wanna win the lottery

(in a mocking voice)Uh...sure I do, and I also wanna be King of 
  my own country and find out what happened to Amelia Earhart
Still on Amelia Earhart
Still on Amelia Earhart
The woman just vanished
The woman just vanished
Seriously, Ross, you don't want in on this

No! Do you know what your odds are of winning the lottery? I...I

Yes but there's six of us so we'd only have to get struck 
  by lightning 7 times
I like those odds
I like those odds
I like those odds
I like those odds

Seriously you guys, I can't believe you're going to spend 250 
  dollars on the lottery, I mean that's such a bunch of boohaki
(looking around at the others)I'll ask. (To Ross) Boohaki

Oh oh, we think Emma is about to start talking so we're trying 
  to be careful about what words we use in front of her

Yeah so get ready to hear alot of ehm...boohaki, goshdarnit 
  and brotherpucker
How do you know she's gonna start talking
How do you know she's gonna start talking
How do you know she's gonna start talking

Well when I talk to her I almost feel like she understands what 
  I'm saying
Kinda like Joey
Kinda like Joey
(who wasn't paying attention)What's that now

lines.Character: (All are returning from the street after picking up dropped lottery ticket
lines.Line: All are returning from the street after picking up dropped lottery tickets

What a beautiful night to be running around the street, looking 
  for tickets. And the wind sure made it fun
Phoebe, we lost half of them

So, what? Monica, we have the winning ticket! My psychic said 
  I was gonna win, remember
Weird.. your psychic didn't mention anything about the scary pigeon..

As a matter of fact she said that's how I am going to die. (pause 
  ) So, excuse me for being a little skittish

(looking at the answering machine) Hey, there's two messages. 
  These could be from work

(looking at the answering machine) Hey, there's two messages. 
  These could be from work
Oh, play them
Ok, here we go! (he pushes the play button

(Phoebe's voice) "Hello. Th-this is the pigeon from the balcony 
  calling to apologise" (they all turns to look at Phoebe) "I sh.. I shouldn't 
  have knocked the tickets out of the pretty lady's hand. It-it was all my fault. 
  Not hers. Bye. Coo.
they all keep staring at Phoebe
they all keep staring at Phoebe
they all keep staring at Phoebe
Well, I bet that was very hard for him to do
"Hey Chandler, it's Charlie
This is..shhh
This is..shhh
This is..shhh

"Listen, oh... it turns I got the last spot. I'm really 
  sorry man, it was a lot of fun working with you. Give me a call if you want.
Oh God, I am so sorry honey..
Oh God, I am so sorry honey..
Oh, so sorry man! Sorry

Oh, it is so unfair. It's like that time they promoted Sandra 
  over me at work
Oh, is she related to Ralph Lauren
Oh, is she related to Ralph Lauren
No, she was just much better at job than me
Guys, the drawing is about to start

(To Ross) You know what? We should call my mum's house and say 
  goodnight to Emma before she goes down
Oh yeah, it's a good idea
Oh yeah, it's a good idea
Oh yeah, it's a good idea

(she hugs Chandler) Honey, you've been really strong about this, 
  I know how badly you wanted that job

Yeah, you know, I really thought I deserved it. (pause) But... 
  let's go win the lottery... I mean, we still have 130 chances to win, right

(she draws out a ticket from a pocket of her pants) 131! (they 
  kiss

(on the phone) Goodnight sweetheart! I love you. And remember, 
  you're daddy's little girl... (covering the phone, to Rachel) Phoebe's totally 
  ruined that for me... (he passes the receiver to Rachel
Hi mum, put her back on
Hi mum, put her back on
Hi mum, put her back on
Hi mum, put her back on

(sitting on the sofa in front of the tv) Rach, come on! They are

"Here we are, the official Powerball numbers! We have 53
I got that
I got that
I got that
Oh, we have one too!
Oh, we have one too!
We are on a roll, people!
(calling Rachel) Come on!
(calling Rachel) Come on!

(on the phone) Mum, please!I know you love your new lips, but

"And number 29! Here we go! The Powerball is 7
Check your numbers! Make me rich
Check your numbers! Make me rich

(she goes towards the others and she's very excited) Guys, you're

  first words!
Wow

Wow

Wow
Wow
Wow
Wow

She said "gleba"!! (she celebrates

Make me rich!
Make me rich!
Make me rich!
(to Ross) Isn't that amazing
(to Ross) Isn't that amazing
Oh yeah, no no no...that's great
Why-why aren't you more excited
Oh, Rach...oh..."gleba" is not a word
Oh, Rach...oh..."gleba" is not a word
Oh, but of course it is
Okay, what does it mean
Okay, what does it mean
I don't know all the words

I'm just, I'm just glad I didn't miss my daughter's first words

Yes you did, gleba is a word
Yes you did, gleba is a word
Ok, use it in a sentence
Ok, use it in a sentence
Ok... "Emma just said gleba"
It's not a word
It's not a word

Okay, okay, okay, fine, I'm gonna look it up (she goes and picks

Oh, oh, ok, great. You know what, while you're at it she said

Rachel glares at him

Rachel glares at him

(searching the dictionary) Alright, okay, okay, gleba, gleba...

phone rings

phone rings
phone rings
(answering phone) Hello? Hold on. It's your boss

Ah, the "I'm sorry I rejected you" phone call. I'm not used 
  to getting it from guys. (on the phone, getting up from the sofa) Hey, Steve

Chandler, hi! I'm sure you've heard we filled the three positions. 
  We just felt that with your maturity and experience, you wouldn't be happy being 
  someone's assistant

Oh no no no no, I'd love to be somebody's assistant! Answering 
  phones, getting coffee, I live for that stuff! And I'm not too mature... farts, 
  boobies, butt cracks

Chandler, you were the strongest person in the program. We're 
  offering you the position of junior copywriter
Me, that guy who just said butt cracks
Me, that guy who just said butt cracks
Me, that guy who just said butt cracks

Yes, that's right. We're excited about the level of sophistication 
  you'll be bringing to the job

Ok well, thanks, you won't regret it. I'll see you tomorrow 
  (hangs up)

(to Chandler) Hey, that is so great about the job.

Well, before, with the wishbone... I didn't wish we would win
